N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 507.1 - Background and intent

State Regulations
(a) Chapter 499 of
the Laws of 1989 authorized the establishment of funding for community based
services for children with serious emotional disturbance. (b) The purpose of a community based system
of mental health services for children with serious emotional disturbance is to
provide services which are responsive to children and families within their
community so as to avoid unnecessary institutionalization and separation of
children from their families and communities. (c) The purpose of these regulations is to
establish standards for the use of the authorized funding for purposes of
developing a comprehensive community based service system within the community
for children with serious emotional disturbance. (d) These regulations provide for the
establishment of an interagency group that has responsibility for monitoring
the system of services, identifying gaps in the service system, recommending
the development of services as appropriate and providing technical assistance
to the member agencies. Notes
